oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pearl Harbor
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pearl Harbor; World War II; ships; U.S. Navy;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A cropped version of a National Archives photograph (80-G-32640). "View looking down 'Battleship Row' from Ford Island Naval Air Station, shortly after the Japanese torpedo plane attack. USS California (BB-44) is at left, listing to port after receiving two torpedo hits. In the center are USS Maryland (BB-46) with the capsized USS Oklahoma (BB-37) alongside. USS Neosho (AO-23) is at right, backing clear of the area. Most smoke is from USS Arizona (BB-39)." Caption from http://www.history.navy.mil/
